sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And his decision to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin before visiting Kyiv has not pleased Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: ANTONIO GUTERRES, Russian President of Ukraine, It has been a long diplomatic tradition that one has to visit Kyiv before going to Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And our request to him is instead of focusing on broad issues like full and comprehensive ceasefire, which is important, but we see what Russia does on the battleground. It's simply not feasible. He should focus primarily on one issue, evocation of Mariupol.

sentences.sentence: ALI ROGIN, Russian President, United States of America, Russia claimed on Monday Evacuation of Marines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia claimed on Monday that it reached an agreement with Kyiv to open humanitarian corridors in Maropol so it can evacuate the Azovstal plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Ukraine has denied that an agreement was reached and has since denounced airstrikes on the steel plant, where both fighters and civilians are sheltering. The port city has been under siege since the start of Russia's invasion. The United Nations Secretary General Antonio Guterres is today meeting Vladimir Putin

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in Moscow. Mr. Guterres' associate spokesman said that the goal is to discuss what could be done urgently to bring peace to Ukraine. Some analysts say that Mr. Guterres could bring up the question of the role of the UN in the peace talks, as well as pressing for humanitarian access and urgent aid to evacuate civilians from Mariupol. The Kremlin has not provided any details of the upcoming talks but there was a short statement from the Russian foreign ministry as Mr guterres will also meet with Sergey Lavrov today the statement says quote the focus will be on the crisis situation in Ukraine which has developed as a result of the eight-year conflict unleashed by Kyiv against the population of Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many analysts believe that the talks in Moscow are going to be quite difficult and say that there is little hope for any breakthrough. On Thursday, Antonio Guterres will also meet with the president of Ukraine in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky has criticized his decision to visit Moscow first, saying that it was simply wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A stark warning from Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is a real danger of a third world war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In an interview on Russian state television, Lavrov said peace talks between Moscow and Kiev will continue, but he accused Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky of only pretending to negotiate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Many of us are convinced that Ukraine's real position is determined in Washington, London and other Western capitals. And therefore, our political analysts say, why talk with President Volodymyr Zelensky's team? We need to talk with the Americans, negotiate with them, reach some kind of agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We still continue to negotiate with the team that Zelensky put forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: These contacts will continue, but as for the Americans, it would be probably useful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But any manifestations of interest on their part regarding contacts on Ukraine or other issues, we do not observe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Kiev, for its part, says Moscow chose war instead of talks when it hit several cities with missiles over the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: Everyone in the world, even those who openly did not support us, now agree that it is in Ukraine that the fate of Europe, the fate of global security and the fate of the democratic system is decided. As the war escalates in the east, Russia appears focused on destroying Ukrainian infrastructure and disrupting military supply routes from foreign countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We do not see the logic of these bombings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One time they fire on the railway, another time they fire on some industrial facilities, next day on residential areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Monday, the Russian military admitted having destroyed six facilities powering railways in several regions using precise guided weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukraine had accused Russia of striking multiple railway stations in the center and west of the country, killing at least five people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As the information war between Kyiv and Moscow continues, a video appearing to show Russian President Vladimir Putin at an Easter church service over the weekend has been called into question, with much online speculation that the images were faked. Matthew, in our social media news desk, The Cube, has been taking a look at the claims. As the war continues in Ukraine, the online misinformation that we're seeing seems now to focus more and more on the leaders of the respective countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's been misinformation recently about Russian President Vladimir Putin and an Orthodox Easter church service held over the weekend in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: False claims have suggested that Putin did not attend this service and instead pre-recorded footage of him was edited into TV broadcasts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: You might have seen claims on Twitter suggesting that Putin was rehearsing for this church service and that in actual fact in some of the shots on television you can't see the Russian president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: These claims have been spread to cast doubt on Putin's health as well as suggest that he has concerns for his security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However if you look at independent news agency photos taken by the Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse, they all show Putin in attendance at this church mass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In all of these images, the Russian president is seen wearing the same dark blue suit, a white shirt and a dark purple tie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And that's an important point because some people had suggested that footage of Putin was taken from last year's church service in 2021. However, if you look again at independent news agency photos, you can see that at last year's service Putin stood in the same position, was wearing a lighter red coloured tie and was also holding a different shaped candle ornament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So there is evidence the Russian president attended this church mass in Moscow over the weekend. And as the war continues to rumble on Helena, we're likely to see more misleading and false claims like this, targeting not just Putin, but also the actions and behavior as well of his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky. This is Euronews Now. We're going to take a short break, but stay tuned for more news.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You can also head to our website, euronews.com, for more updates on the war in Ukraine and our other top stories.
